multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a painful non-healing wound on my left lower leg.
How long have you had this non-healing wound?
The wound developed two months ago.
Have you had any recent injuries or surgeries to that leg?
No, I have not had any recent injuries or surgeries to that leg.
Do you have any chronic medical conditions like diabetes, vascular disease, or autoimmune disorders?
Yes, I have Crohn's disease.
Do you take any medications for the Crohn's disease, particularly corticosteroids or immunosuppressants?
I'm sorry, but I didn't mention taking any specific medications for my Crohn's disease.
Are you currently taking any medications for your Crohn's disease? If yes, could you specify which ones?
I'm sorry, but I didn't mention any specific medications that I'm currently taking for my Crohn's disease.
Do you have any other areas on your body with similar wounds or just the one on your leg?
Just the one on my leg.
Is there a history of similar wounds in your family?
I didn't mention any family history of similar wounds.
Could you describe the appearance of the wound? Is there any drainage, what color is it, and does it have a particular smell?
The wound has a cribriform base with yellow-red exudate and it is well demarcated, ovoid, with violaceous rolled borders.
Final Diagnosis: Pyoderma gangrenosum.
